ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Middle Ear Effusion
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Unilateral conductive hearing loss, flat tympanogram (Type B), and absent reflexes post-trauma are consistent with fluid in the middle ear.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Ossicular Discontinuity
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Trauma history and conductive loss could suggest ossicular issues, though the flat tympanogram strongly favors effusion over discontinuity (which typically shows Type Ad).

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine the degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To evaluate middle ear function and tympanic membrane mobility.
To assess the integrity of the acoustic reflex arc and support differential diagnosis of conductive pathology.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The evaluation reveals normal hearing in the right ear and a mild-to-moderate conductive hearing loss in the left ear. Tympanometry indicates normal middle ear function on the right but significant dysfunction (flat, Type B) on the left, consistent with the patient's 'underwater' sensation. Acoustic reflexes are absent in the left ear and for contralateral stimulation, confirming a conductive component.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Normal hearing (0-10 dB HL). Left ear: Mild rising to slight conductive loss (250-1000 Hz) sloping to mild/moderate (2000-8000 Hz) with 25-40 dB air-bone gaps.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRTs agree with PTA (Right 3 dB, Left 27 dB). WRS is excellent bilaterally (Right 100%, Left 92%).

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Type A (normal). Left ear: Type B (flat).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Right ipsilateral present. Left ipsilateral, Left contralateral, and Right contralateral absent.

proposed_items: Monitor for resolution of middle ear effusion
Possible pressure equalization tube placement if effusion persists
counseling_actions: Explain the conductive nature of the hearing loss
Discuss the likelihood of middle ear fluid ('underwater' sensation) resulting from the trauma
Advise on the need for ENT medical evaluation

escalation.rationale_short: To medically evaluate and treat the unilateral conductive hearing loss and diagnosed middle ear effusion.

follow_up_plan.objective: To determine if the effusion resolves spontaneously or requires surgical intervention (PE tubes).

expected_outcome: Diagnosed with middle ear effusion by the ENT specialist.
Plan established to watch for resolution or consider pressure equalization tube.
